results.title: Winds and their causes
results.brief_description: The crash on a model aeroplane serves as an introduction to the study of winds and their causes; thermals, cumulus clouds, thunderstorms, on and off-shore breezes, easterlies and westerlies are explained in the simplest of terms.

results.title: Windrider
results.creator_credit: Vincent Monton, Paul D. Barron and Barron Films
results.brief_description: A windsurfer becomes obsessed with a woman who has been watching him surf. He undertakes a comical and unrelenting search for her which eventually wears down his resistance. Underlying his passion for her is the windsurfers’ determination to win the World Classic Windsurfing Championships for which he is preparing an unbeatable windsurfing rig. Stars Tom Burlinson and Nicole Kidman with Jill Perryman and Charles Tingwell.

results.title: Windows
results.creator_credit: Gordon Willis, Mike Lobell and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: This psycho-thriller with sexual overtones is the only directorial effort by acclaimed cinematographer Gordon Willis, who photographed many of Woody Allen’s films. Emily (Talia Shire) is a painfully introverted woman whose confidence has been further shattered by a rape attack. Her neighbour Andrea (Elizabeth Ashley), is a lesbian with a murderous past who harbours an obsessive attraction for Emily. With a highly homophobic script that provides no logic or motivation for the character’s actions, only the camerawork (by Willis) and score (by Ennio Morricone) redeem the film.

results.title: Window on the world
results.creator_credit: Lex Halliday, Jean Halliday and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Shows the manufacture of Australian louvre windows in a Queensland factory. High grade steel is pressed and cut to form the side brackets; clips to hold the glass are stamped, formed and fitted onto bronze bearing completing a simple, rust and weather-proof frame which locks automatically when closed. The installation of louvre windows is shown. Although many louvres are exported to overseas, the home market uses an ever-increasing number of these windows which are ideally suited to Australian conditions.

results.title: Window on Canada. No. 29
results.creator_credit: Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Host Clyde Gilmour introduces pioneer filmmaker Norman McLaren and presents three of his works. McLaren demonstrates and explains the different animation techniques used in each. Seen are: La-Haut sur ces montagnes and C’est l’aviron from the series Les Chants Populaires, and the upbeat short Boogie Doodle. The film ends with a discussion of McLaren’s work in India and China while on loan to UNESCO from 1949 to 1950. We see two short educational films made by his students in China, using techniques McLaren has taught them.

results.title: Window into space: the Parkes radio telescope
results.creator_credit: David Corke, S.T. Evans and CSIRO
results.brief_description: The 210-foot Parkes Radio Telescope is one of the largest steerable instruments in the world and the largest in the Southern Hemisphere, a parabolic antenna suitable for a wide range of wavelengths, which may be directed with high precision over most of the visible sky. How the installation works is explained briefly and the significance of some observations made with it is discussed.

results.title: Windom's way
results.creator_credit: Ronald Neame, John Bryan and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: Dr Alec Windom (Peter Finch) is a resident doctor on the island of Selim in South East Asia. He is a committed and dedicated doctor to both his patients and the wider community which is currently experiencing unrest. It is into this environment that Windom’s estranged wife, Lee (Mary Ure) arrives. Because of his prominent and respected position in society, Windom attempts to act as mediator between the exploited natives and the Government to prevent a native uprising but is thwarted by betrayal from the authorities. Disillusioned by his inability to reconcile the situation and by the betrayal that occurs, Windom prepares to leave the country with his wife. Cast also includes Natasha Parry, Robert Flemying, Michael Horderna and Marne Maitland. Based on a novel by James Ramsay Ullman.
